description.narrative: The Project will be achieved by promotes cross-convetion synergy by reducing GHG and CFC emissions though improving energy efficiency in buldings
independent political entity
Access to EE services and commercial financing for public sector buildings enhanced with a PBI
10 ESCOs develop and implement pilot projects on public sector buildings

comment.narrative: Limited experience in ESCO projects in public buildings
Five pilot projects for public building sector by the end of Yr 3

Executive projects for the retrofit of MMA ready The Retrofit project has recieved Procel Label which is issued to most efficient projects triple A lighting envelope air conditioning This was the first federal building in Brasilia to have PROCEL label and it broke the paradigm that the building envelope could not be A at the Esplanada In order to implement the EE measures the eletric project and digital network projects are being procured Given the budget restrictions in the whole public sector in 2015 MMA will have to search for alternative sources to implement measures and is partnering with ANEEL National Electric Energy Agency and local utilities to identify resources available for implementation
Five pilot projects for public building sector by the end of Yr 3

Executive projects for the retrofit of MMA ready The Retrofit project has recieved Procel Label which is issued to most efficient projects triple A lighting envelope air conditioning This was the first federal building in Brasilia to have PROCEL label and it broke the paradigm that the building envelope could not be A at the Esplanada In order to implement the EE measures the eletric project and digital network projects are being procured Given the budget restrictions in the whole public sector in 2015 MMA will have to search for alternative sources to implement measures and is partnering with ANEEL National Electric Energy Agency and local utilities to identify resources available for implementation

description.narrative: 9 Number of public projects undertaken by ESCOS under the PBI approach

comment.narrative: No tender process for public buildings under performance contract
Average of 15 RFPsyear based on PBI approach

The PBI aproach should be considered more as a partnership with public agents working on energy effficency than an independent initiative within the project and the number of 15 RFPs anually based on PBI might be infeasible to accomplish In order to achieve a higher number of procurement proccess of EE projetcs in the public sector and indicate best ways to implement EE projects a public call was launched to gather energy consumption data from public office buildings Given the difficulty to recieve data it was extended to 5 months 320 buildings data were gathered This information will be analysed and structured in a benchmarking of energy consumption which will define a consumption indicators for public buildings KWhm2 20 buildings will be selected for energy audits and at least five buildings will be assisted juridically and technically to procure and implement energy effciency projetcs
Average of 15 RFPsyear based on PBI approach

The PBI aproach should be considered more as a partnership with public agents working on energy effficency than an independent initiative within the project and the number of 15 RFPs anually based on PBI might be infeasible to accomplish In order to achieve a higher number of procurement proccess of EE projetcs in the public sector and indicate best ways to implement EE projects a public call was launched to gather energy consumption data from public office buildings Given the difficulty to recieve data it was extended to 5 months 320 buildings data were gathered This information will be analysed and structured in a benchmarking of energy consumption which will define a consumption indicators for public buildings KWhm2 20 buildings will be selected for energy audits and at least five buildings will be assisted juridically and technically to procure and implement energy effciency projetcs

description.narrative: 8 PBI Program for Public Buildings operational by end of project including EE tender processes alternatives

comment.narrative: The current purchasing mechanism for public sector is lowest cost only
Model for PBI designed by end of first year Public sector EE Promotion plan drafted and submitted to the Gov for adoption by the end of Yr 2

Despite of PBI not being structured as described in PRODOC the Project is partnering with the most important initiatives in the public sector to promote energy efficiency such as Programa Esplanada Sustentável PES Programa A3P Environmental Agenda in the Public Administration with the Secretariats of Information Technology and Logistics SLTI and Federal Budget SOF both from the Planning Ministry and PROCEL Brazilian Energy Conservation Program to improve and enhance the results and impacts of existing initiatives to promote energy efficiency Conclusion of the direct contract of CBCS Brazilian Council for Sustainable Construction to implement a benchmarking of energy consumption in public buildings offices aiming to define indicators and implement 20 energy audits in public buildings in order to identify best cases to demonstrate procedures for procurement of EE projets The project is providing technical assistance for the consolidation of the Normative Instruction IN02 SLTI and the Ordinance 23 both elaborated by the Planning ministry and aimed at defining energy efficiency standards and monitoring procedures for public buildings
Model for PBI designed by end of first year Public sector EE Promotion plan drafted and submitted to the Gov for adoption by the end of Yr 2

Despite of PBI not being structured as described in PRODOC the Project is partnering with the most important initiatives in the public sector to promote energy efficiency such as Programa Esplanada Sustentável PES Programa A3P Environmental Agenda in the Public Administration with the Secretariats of Information Technology and Logistics SLTI and Federal Budget SOF both from the Planning Ministry and PROCEL Brazilian Energy Conservation Program to improve and enhance the results and impacts of existing initiatives to promote energy efficiency Conclusion of the direct contract of CBCS Brazilian Council for Sustainable Construction to implement a benchmarking of energy consumption in public buildings offices aiming to define indicators and implement 20 energy audits in public buildings in order to identify best cases to demonstrate procedures for procurement of EE projets The project is providing technical assistance for the consolidation of the Normative Instruction IN02 SLTI and the Ordinance 23 both elaborated by the Planning ministry and aimed at defining energy efficiency standards and monitoring procedures for public buildings

description.narrative: EEGM made available to stimulate EE investment through ESCOs
15 Number of ESCOs andor financial institutions using portfolio guarantees such as the EEGM

comment.narrative: Few ESCOs can borrow from commercial Banks they use ANEEL fund and own money or partly client money
At least 250 projects approved under the EEGM and provided with guarantees

One more letter issued to APS Engenharia in the amount of US 73553000 leveraging around US 1600000 in investments in retrofits of more than 50 units on retailer chain Renner EEGM has the total of 4 closed projects and there is a current pipeline of 7 more 2 of which are in final negotiations

description.narrative: Enhanced EE investments through CB in EE in private public buildings
7 Increased awareness and interest by market players in implementing EE measures

comment.narrative: Limited awareness activities conducted by the Authorities on the benefits of EE
Up to 5000 people from public and private building sector trained 2000 stakeholders reached with project publications and 1000 unique visitors to project website six months after site is launched

Average of 12000 accesses monthly in Projeteee httpprojeteeeufscbr a reference online plataform developed to support the design of new efficient buildings Dissemination of lessons learnt in the labelling of MMA buliding by distribution of 3000 copies of the publication Practical Guide for energy efficiency the experience of project labelling from MMA Ministry of Environment The Project created a visual identity and developed a series of dissemination materials folders banners logo ecobags pencards The Projects website is active and hosted in MMAs webpage under ClimateEnergy httpmmagovbrclimaenergiaedifC3ADcios
Up to 5000 people from public and private building sector trained 2000 stakeholders reached with project publications and 1000 unique visitors to project website six months after site is launched

description.narrative: 5 EE offer fully functional in private and public building sector

comment.narrative: Limited capacity in term of EE offer from local market players
EE building market capacity building in progress by Yr 1 Efficiency Improvement in Brazil reinforced by Yr 5

Capacity Development Plan Revised and two new Technical Cooperation Agreements stablished in the private sector with Green Building Council and ABESCO National ESCO Association to help implement capacity development activities and disseminate EE business model A company was hired to elaborate 2 practical guides Building CertificationLabelling and Energy audits and 8 videos on PBE Edifica National Building Labelling Program that will be used in trainings and dissemination activities in the public and private sectors Total of 400 people trained on EE financing and PBE Edifica
EE building market capacity building in progress by Yr 1 Efficiency Improvement in Brazil reinforced by Yr 5

Capacity Development Plan Revised and two new Technical Cooperation Agreements stablished in the private sector with Green Building Council and ABESCO National ESCO Association to help implement capacity development activities and disseminate EE business model A company was hired to elaborate 2 practical guides Building CertificationLabelling and Energy audits and 8 videos on PBE Edifica National Building Labelling Program that will be used in trainings and dissemination activities in the public and private sectors Total of 400 people trained on EE financing and PBE Edifica

description.narrative: Interest enhanced in the replacement of energyinefficient CFCusing chillers
11 Number of professionals trained on replacement of energy inefficient chillers CFC and nonCFC

comment.narrative: No professionals trained
120 professionals ESCOs and entrepreneurs trained

The indicators of component 3 have chaged substantially once this outcome was turned into a new Project BRA12G77 The chillers inventory showed that there are very few chillers operating with CFC in Brazil and that there are aprox 130000 equipments in operation with HCFC22 Therefore HCFC was included in the spectrum of chillers approached by this outcome Outcome1 BRA12G77 National Inventory of CFC and HCFC developed Indicator Number of CFC chillers in Brazil assessed
120 professionals ESCOs and entrepreneurs trained

description.narrative: 12 Technical guidelines for CFC chiller replacement prepared and used

comment.narrative: No technical guidelines in place
02 practical guidelines published and at least 60 professionals using them

BRA12G77 Outcome 2 Technical and information materials to promote and disseminate results achieved with CFC and HCFS chillers developed and distributed
Outcome 3 Workshops and trainings to specialized professionals and building owners interested in the replacement CFC and HCFC chillers implemented

description.narrative: 13 Chiller replacement programme in place

comment.narrative: The inventory of CFCbased chillers is accepted as 1000 centrifugal chillers
Up to 40 CFCbased chillers replacement demonstration projects using MLF cofinancing implemented by the end of Yr 2

A public call to select 2 buildings in the private sector in São Paulo to implement retrocomissining in cold water conditioning systems opened The retrocomissioning will be developed and reported as best practices in publications and trainings
BRA12G77 Outcome Retrocomissioning Processes in chillers with CFC e HCFC developed
Indicator 04 retrocomissioning 2 in the privat sector and 2 in the public sector

description.narrative: To foster EE investments in private and public buildings in Brazil
4 Number of new EE implemented projects using the EEGM or other similar mechanism due to the Project

comment.narrative: Financing institutions are not aware on how they can support the development of EE market
At least 250 projects implemented resulting in direct CO2 emission reduction of 2 MT CO2 and postproject and indirect 16 MT CO2

Since last PIR 1 more letter was issued by EEGM to APS Engenharia total of 4 letters EEGM has the total of 4 closed projects and there is a current pipeline of 7 more 2 of which are in final negotiations The four closed totaled US16M leveraging US 10 million It is important to note that the goal of 250 projects considered some assumptions that did not occur total revolving of resources in year 3 and small ize of projects therefore the resources available in EEGM and the demonstrative projects implemented by component 2 shall achieve 35 to 40 projetcs nationally in the best scenario
At least 250 projects implemented resulting in direct CO2 emission reduction of 2 MT CO2 and postproject and indirect 16 MT CO2

Since last PIR 1 more letter was issued by EEGM to APS Engenharia total of 4 letters EEGM has the total of 4 closed projects and there is a current pipeline of 7 more 2 of which are in final negotiations The four closed totaled US16M leveraging US 10 million It is important to note that the goal of 250 projects considered some assumptions that did not occur total revolving of resources in year 3 and small ize of projects therefore the resources available in EEGM and the demonstrative projects implemented by component 2 shall achieve 35 to 40 projetcs nationally in the best scenario

description.narrative: 2 Rate of public and private building ownersoperators reported to use ESCOs services to improve their energy consumption at least 80

comment.narrative: Govt buildings operation do not specify minimum EE performance values
Local banking system provide financing in 70 of EE projects

There is a huge complexity to measure the utilization of EE services for the total building stock once only in the federal sphere there are 28000 buildings However through a 5 month public call the Project has managed to identify energy consumption detailed data from 320 public buildings office to define the baseline of consumption and specify performance values
Local banking system provide financing in 70 of EE projects

description.narrative: 3 Number of FI offering energy savings guarantee services to other sources

comment.narrative: Professionals and developers do not understand basic EE principles
At least 10 FIs and value at least 123M in total of financed EE investment enabled by the Project including by local FIs

Two regional Banks Desenvolve São Paulo and AgeRio Estate Foment Agency of Rio de Janeiro have been assessed and aproved by IDB to use the EEGM BNDES is part of the Consultive Committee and has been very active The Project is trying to enhance cooperation with National Bank Associations and Federations ABBC and FEBRABAN and the reestructuring of PROESCO might increase the number and amount of financed projects

description.narrative: 1 Increase in the number and in annual revenues of EE project developers

comment.narrative: Very few buildings ownersoperators have incorporated EE measures
Increase in investment in EE for building public and private sectors by USD93 million

The Project is intensively informing and training service providers and project developers about the normative instruction IN 02 and PBE Edifica The Planning Ministry MPOG has launched an ordinance in Feb 2015 that stablishes best practices and monitoring indicators for energy use in public buildings MPOG is being technically assisted by the Project In 2015 Brazil was considered to enter recession the prices of energy rose 60 and energy efficiency came back to the deabte however the interest rates and the availability of financial resources decreased there is a potential for speeding and enhancing the number of EE projects but it unclear if EE investments will peak
Increase in investment in EE for building public and private sectors by USD93 million

The Project is intensively informing and training service providers and project developers about the normative instruction IN 02 and PBE Edifica The Planning Ministry MPOG has launched an ordinance in Feb 2015 that stablishes best practices and monitoring indicators for energy use in public buildings MPOG is being technically assisted by the Project In 2015 Brazil was considered to enter recession the prices of energy rose 60 and energy efficiency came back to the deabte however the interest rates and the availability of financial resources decreased there is a potential for speeding and enhancing the number of EE projects but it unclear if EE investments will peak
